Reviews.Title: “Worst Place on Earth.”
Reviews.Author: HannahFK
Reviews.Content: This was officially the worst hostel I have stayed in in my three months of travelling. Mould and filth on walls;toilet unusable;shower too scary to enter;sheets and pillows stained;every time we came home someone else was claiming our beds;money stolen;dirtiest conditions I've ever experienced! By the end we did experiments of leaving rubbish around to see if it got cleaned up during our 5 day stay - it did not. We opted to be homeless each day rather than ever return to the hostel, how this place is still open is beyond comprehension.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping on the streets would have been an improvement”
Reviews.Author: SamZ369
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hostel with a friend for four nights, which was four nights too many. This hostel was disgusting - we had to hold our breaths to enter the washrooms, allocate a pair of shoes to enter the showers (covered with black hair and unidentifiable substances), and even though my blanket was covered in stains, I returned to find various people sleeping in my bed. There were not enough lockers for the number of people in our room. The highlight of our hotel croydon experience was seeing the shocked and disgusted responses of people when they entered our room for the first time. Honestly, splurge a few extra euros and save yourself the feeling that you might be contracting diseases from your bed - stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: Adam E Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with two friends in a dormatory! rooms where cleanish and bed sheets were clean and changed regularly. Only downside was the majorly steep staircase it is like climbing a ladder espically if you are on the top floor like we were! also lockers already had locks on them and the guy at the help desk wasnt interested! On the whole its a bed for the night and for being so cheap you can't really complain

Reviews.Title: “Not good for backpackers”
Reviews.Author: R H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The floor in the room is easy to noisy when walk on it and the bed is not good. The bathroom is not very clean. Above all, can't sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “worse hostel I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: anaojjoana
Reviews.Content: Liked: the location, and just it! Disliked: everything else than location. The place was mucky, completely unclean. The bathroom was disgusting (don't forget flip flops if you are thinking about staying in this hostel). The lockers simply don't lock, so that they stole things from my bag. And the stairs was terrible, but I think it's normal to Amsterdam.. It was really bad, definitely the worse hostel I ever stayed. Tip: Think twice before going to this hostel, because with a good location there are many hostels in Amsterdam, and for less 3 or 5 euros, croydon hostel doesn't worth it!

Reviews.Title: “would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: we booked this hostel 1 hour before we got on the plane to Amsterdam, it is what you pay for really, its a hostel, it isnt going to be the cleanest place, ther was 3 of us that went (3 females) we didnt know who we would be sharing a room with when we turned up but the man at reception was very friendly and we had a room to ourselves, i think they have a policy where there arent mixed dorms, as for the lockers in the rooms, we thought they were safe, we left all of our belongings in there in the day, took all of the valuables ie money and passport. the only down fall about this place was we was on the top floor and the stairs are so steep and narrow, but so are all of the stair cases in the dam! all in all i would go back to this place, it was worth the money you are a minutes walk from everywhere, amazing crepe and waffle shop underneath for when you get the munchies and its really easy to find!!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: cvetanovska s Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: LOCATION IS PERFECT....EVERYTHING ON YOUR DOOR STEP....WE HAD A FANTASTIC TIME......PANCAKES DOWNSTAIRS JUST DELICIOUS.......stacaff helpfull......yous tay in this hostel you get 20% off in the Irish pub next door and 10% off on pancakes downstairs near the reception

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nil security”
Reviews.Author: Linhbo
Reviews.Content: Great location as it's right in the red light district however the rooms are quite noisy because of this. Warning to guests - do not leave anything in the lockers. During our stay our stuff was stolen from our locker and the guest who stole it still had a key for the room. Reception is located in the back of a waffle shop and the front door is often open so people come and go freely from the hostel. The place is a bit noisy and dirty - we found a centipede in our room. Fine for a cheap bed but not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: welsh_bookworn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hostel last week for three nights, and was quite concerned after reading the reviews before travelling. We stayed in a room for 4 at the back of the hostel and on the first floor. The steps were steep to here, and looked really narrow and steep up to the higher floors. But this is just what the stairs are like in the older buildings in Amsterdam, so I don't think there's much that can be done about it. Despite being right in the heart of the city centre, the room we had was quiet at night and we all slept well. The beds were fairly comfortable, although with an odd selection of bedding - I had a sheet and a duvet, while another member of the party just had a thick blanket. The bathrooms were clean and tidy whenever we used them. The staff we spoke to were pretty friendly, and the waffles downstairs were great. It wasn't a luxury stay, but what can you expect when you pay like Â£16 a night for city centre accommodation! It was great to be so close to the Centraal Station and Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ianholloway2011
Reviews.Content: I think most of the other comments on here are a bit unfair. The place is ok, nothing special, but that's what you'd expect for a hostel. The location is good, just down the road from Dam square and the main red light district. The beds are comfy, bathroom was clean. The stairs are really steep, but this is like how most of the buildings in Amsterdam are built, but is manageable. There weren't any rats, however there does seem to be a mice problem. I'd advise people to take their own sheets as there was some specks of blood on the sheets provided. All in all it's a good cheap place to stay, it's very basic but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hostel of a month-long trip”
Reviews.Author: Rhod G
Reviews.Content: I laughed off the reviews about the stairs before booking, but they really are hilariously life-threatening. When I stayed they had actually removed the banisters to redecorate which made getting up to the room a commerically viable basis for a TV gameshow survivor-challenge. That aside, this is easily the worst hostel I stayed in over the course of a month trip round Europe. It doesn't even look like a legitimate business, their office is in the back of a waffle shop next door - you have to walk past customers eating to reach their reception! You a greeted with 'NO REFUNDS' signs plastered all over the walls, not surprising because I am sure they are asked about it regularly. My belongings were actually nibbled on by mice/rats during my 2 night stay, a suspicion confirmed by the rat traps we found under all the beds in our room. If you smoke you need to be buzzed in and out for a cigarette due to a ridiculous front door system. We always returned to find our bedroom unlocked again, the bathrooms are pretty grim and shared between too many people, the staff obviously hate you, the whole place is disgustingly dirty and badly furnished, it smells awful all the time and unsettling cameras everywhere make you feel very self-conscious. You will not get any sleep whatsoever due to the noise coming from both in- and outside of the hostel - but on the plus side this is because its located in the middle of the red light district (maybe a minus depending on the kind of trip you want). Its not even very cheap, certainly not cheap enough to justify choosing this hostel over any other. If it will cost you â‚¬5 more to stay elsewhere just do it. The only reason to go is for character strengthening or to test your moral fibre. At least, like other reviewers, I too was pleasantly surprised to find I hadn't been murdered by the end of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hostel”
Reviews.Author: AllAroundTheWorld41
Reviews.Content: To get to the room, we had to climb 3 sets of really steep suicidal stairs. The first one is straight, but the other ones are curved and really narrowed. The room is really standard, except for the fact that the bathroom terribly stinks. When you take a shower, water gets everywhere in the bathroom. It is located in the Red Light district so the quality of our sleep was really poor. This hostel doesn't worth the price at all. If you read this, take it seriously, do not go there.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: SnowWhite86
Reviews.Content: We accidentally requested an 8-person room, instead of 4-person room. They charged us for the 8 beds, and both nights we woke up with 4 roommates. They refunded us 40 Euros. Besides ripping us off, the place was revolting. Wretched bathroom, broken storage lockers, lock on door didn't work properly and dirty blankets. Had to go up 3 flights of dangerous, ridiculous, winding, narrow stairs. Could barely squeeze through with backpacks on. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jh07rw
Reviews.Content: As a bunch of students my party and I were looking for a cheap room in a great location so we could experience the real Amsterdam. Hotel Croydon provided this for us. It was right in the heart of the city and near the train station so really easy to. The beds were clean and comfy and it had a 24 hour reception so you can come and go as you please. Yes the stairs were steep but that is just the style of the buildings in the center of Amsterdam. I would recommend this to students or travelers who are looking for a decent place to stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “crap, stinks place which cheats guests”
Reviews.Author: niceboyagp
Reviews.Content: my parents and I stayed there last week. I read lots of review about that hotel. most of the reviews are complains about that hotel. when we got there we were abit shocked. the hotel looks so different from the pictures on the booking website. It is stinks and dirty(there must be more descriptions about that place). They just check your room but not clean it:) They refuse doing any services, because they were busing enjoy doing nothing at work. today I got e-mail from the booking website that said we did not show up at the hotel and they are charging me for staying there 1 night (90 euro). oh ya, that is because the reception refused us to use credit card, so we payed cash for 3 nights. this thing has never happened to me before, I will talk to my bank and see what I can do. It is really worth to pay alittle more to stay some other place instead of.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it!!!This place should be inspected and their license should be taken away.”
Reviews.Author: LondonLovingholidays
Reviews.Content: I can't even believe they can get away with charging for this hotel!!! The place is absolutely awful. It stinks, there is luck of even basic things hygiene and I wouldn't wash even animals that bathroom. I don't have words for this place. We arrived there at midnight after our flight has been delayed so we were looking forward to go to bed. But once we stepped into our room (the hallway already looked pretty dreadful) I started to cry. I just couldn't see myself spending there any time. We paid 70Euro for a stinky room, very noisy and dirty, the blankets didn't have sheets on them (and I doubt they wash the whole blankets after each use), the bathroom was disgusting and we haven't been given towels. This place should be inspected and their license should be taken away.

Reviews.Title: “DONT i repeat Dont stay here it is like Faulty Towers without the comedy”
Reviews.Author: Rocker82
Reviews.Content: this place is the most awful place i have ever stayed in there was grafitti on the wall out of the two rooms we looked at this one was the best the other had no window there was a hole were the window was though the tv was not working it smells to high heaven or hell even the doors didnt lock or unlock properly the door hadle was almost falling out the stairs are so steep i actually thought it was built by Paula Radcliffe and you would proberly die from whiplash if there was a fire oh we were in room #9 #8 had no window and the carpet was so disgusting i thought about buying asbestos socks just to walk around

Reviews.Title: “the only friendly thing bout this place was the rats”
Reviews.Author: shaunacon
Reviews.Content: this place is is really bad... the smells, the dirt, the rats, i could go on and on and on. to be honest i dont no how its still open. the older staff are really sexist... they would only talk to the men that were with us, would only take money of the men...and all the staff are men! when you walk outside your meet by a sea of drug dealers that try to nick your handbag do not trust theses fellas!!!!!!and hold on to your wallet/bag for your life.... if you still want to stay here just make sure you have back up accommo you wont stay long trust me

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: DeKreeft27
Reviews.Content: Oh boy. This place was so bad, I think back on it like tragicomedy. In some ways, recounting the horrors of it have provided me more enjoyment than any nice hotel ever did. That being said, I would NEVER stay here again. Highlights. Four beds in the room all different sizes with different sheets that they found at the Salvation Army. More importantly, the sheets were FULL of cigarette hole burns, as was the carpet, and the walls, and the furniture. The sink was broken and continuously dripped. Couldn't be turned more off or more on. We heard consistent screaming and vomiting from the "courtyard' our window faced. The courtyard itself was full of standing, putrescent water. The shared toilet was broken. Scrawled above my bed in huge indelible marker it read "Dear Mr. Croydon, 50,000 Lira are fly away from my bag. The room is full of bugs. Thank you"

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this hotel! -if you can call it a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Earny
Reviews.Content: Well...i'll start from the beginning Firstly don't turn up to this place expecting to pay the rest of the money on your credit card because they insist you pay in cash up front, before you even see the room. After climbing the two steepest flights of stairs in my life with a suitcase in tow, we arrived at our room, greeted by a strange smell. There were cigarette burns all over the sheets, graffitti on the walls from previous people, and to sum this place up it was awful. Noise- Church bells ring from 7am-12pm without fail and the only time this place gets quiet is around 5am-7am! Don't expect much sleep in this place, the noise of rats scratching behind your bed will keep you awake all night anyway. One last thing, toilet did'nt flush, shower was useless and the smell in the bathroom was disgusting! DON'T STAY HERE!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Croydon
HotelInfo.Address: Warmoes Straat 75, Amsterdam, The Netherlands
